lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Season nine centers on the semi-functioning alcohol seaplane pilot, Sterling Archer, as we know, a lush on a lush South Pacific island of Mitimotu in 1939. While the rest of the world is concerned about the impending Second World War, Archer is only concerned with who is buying his next drink. Along with his trusty copilot, Pam, one of my favorite characters, Sterling must navigate quicksand, cannibals, super-intelligent monkeys, poison darts, and pirates. That's right, folks. Somehow they jumped the shark into even better shark-infested waters.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15 to ten.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hold on, 15 to ten.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ten. Whoa. What? You guys are all single digits? Oh boy!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I always roll shit initiative.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You do. You really do.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I don't know what--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Historically.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Ten to five.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Beau at nine.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Seven.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Five.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Wow! Molly, Jester. That's everybody, right?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Four. I rolled four.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And four.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Und Ein.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You don't have any initiative?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, do I? Oh sure, two.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, so you rolled a three. Good job.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, no. Plus one, so now it's two.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What's a two in German?

lines.name: LIAM, TALIESIN, LAURA
lines.text: Zwei.

lines.name: SAM, TALIESIN, LAURA
lines.text: Eins, zwei, drei.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's it. That's all the numbers in German.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Caleb, you're holding up the rear?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ja.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh god, I'm first?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: First and foremost, Fjord, you're up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, right, okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It has completely attached itself, and the end of its tendrils coming to these pointed hook protrusions, this thick flesh webbing between each of these tentacles that form the umbrella-type shape, have all engulfed most of Nott, and you hear the muffled (muffled yelling) from within, and the little bit of the feet trying desperately to hold onto the boat and maintain balance.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Jesus. Do I have a clear line of sight to Nott and octopus fuck?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay. I won't hit Caleb, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Probably not. You know what you're doing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It looks like no, I'm seeing your angle.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm pretty sturdy though, so I wouldn't sweat it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: As I'm looking, is it Nott and then octopus behind it, or is it enveloping him so I can't--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, it's enveloped, and is currently wrapped around.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right. I'm going to send an Eldritch Blast towards the octopus.

lines.name: SAM, ASHLEY, TALIESIN
lines.text: (muffled yelling)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Not again!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, my glasses are in my car, shit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's a 21 to hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That hits, go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That is 1d10. That is eight points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eight points of damage, nice. Does that end your turn?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do I take any of that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, you do not.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's nice.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Actually, with my bonus action, can I cast Hex on umbrella fuck?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You cannot, unfortunately, because-- Well, no, because Eldritch Blast is a cantrip, so you can.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes you can.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Woo! That's 1d--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, you would have had to have done that first.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's right. That's on the next thing, right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct. But next time it gets hit by you, you can add extra damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Copy that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. That finishes your go.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, it's like Hunter's Mark.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Now it's their turn. Being attached to there, the strange darkmantle-like beast--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can it have disadvantage on strength checks?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It can, sure.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I never said that before. I got to remember.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's okay. It's not that big a deal.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You watch as it begins to slowly crush around Nott, instead its eyes flash red, and you watch as a familiar-looking orb of blackness emanates from it, completely filling this space with darkness. So at the moment, everyone on that boat is blind.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Wait, I don't think I can-- since I have danger sense, can I be blinded?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can be blinded, but you have advantage on dexterity saving throws against things that you see.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But do you see it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So it did like an ink cloud.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Essentially, but a magical darkness that radiates outside of it. Another one going towards the source of the beam of light that had emitted and damaged its ally sweeps down towards Fjord and attempts to go ahead and wrap around.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shit!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is going to be 21 to hit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That definitely hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You take five points of bludgeoning damage as well--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, another one came down on Fjord?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And attaches itself to Fjord, yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, no.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (muffled yelling)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's going to make us blind too, we got to kill it quick.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That brings us to Nott, you're up.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I try to get out of the grapple? Is that a thing that I can do?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can attempt to. You have to make a strength check to do so.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. I will push with all my little might against the creepy-- Ooh! Just a strength check?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, a strength check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, that'll do it. So you manage to break free from its grasp.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (yell) That's my action.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I can't see it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nope, it is just darkness. You push it off of you, and you still have nothing before you. You didn't see the darkness emit from it, you've just thrown it off and you're still blind. It's a little off putting to you at the moment.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, I'll spend the rest of my turn trying to figure out if that was caused by just touching the water. Because I'm not sure what happened.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, you throw the creature off, whatever is on you, and it's just darkness around you. You start reaching out for some sort of sign of something in your vicinity.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Are you holding an action?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I used my action to--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, that's right. That's your turn. That brings us to Beau.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. I'm going to go (mild screaming) and do a straight whack on it. Sorry Fjord, it's on you! Ooh, that's a natural 19. 25.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 25 hits, roll damage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We'll remember where they are. It's fine, just leave them.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What is it? 1d-- that's not great, six damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's glomped onto Fjord's head, the rest of it pulling and wrapping into the insides of his armor. You hit it just above where-- you feel the impact, Fjord, but it's mostly absorbed by the strange, rubbery, flesh exterior of this creature.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ow.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Did I hurt you?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay! (whack) I deck him right across the face. Yeah, I'll take that, 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That'll hit, roll damage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's like getting punched with a motorcycle helmet on.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Seven damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nice. You clock both this creature and Fjord across the chin. No damage to you, Fjord, but you are a bit dizzy from the impact in the darkness around your face.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (strained) I feel like that was personal.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ah, one more. I'm going to do flurry of blows.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh boy.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (impacts)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Essentially.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's a natural 17. That's a four, eight damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eight damage, nice.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sick, good turn.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We are level four. Eight damage, sick.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: After you deck the darkmantle across the face and Fjord, you backhand with a full back fist blow to the side. You see it almost detach, and it's looking like it's scrambling to hold on. That finishes your turn?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Uh-huh.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I am definitely woozy.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That brings us to Molly.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to stop saying that. That's a 23 to hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That hits. Roll damage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (gunshot)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you. Nine points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you take the blade and swing, you cut down pretty close to where Fjord's head is. As you cleave through the body actually splits, revealing Fjord's face. As it limply falls off into the water slinking into the sludge.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It looks like he was being born.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Thanks.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Welcome! We probably should head towards the other one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That ends your turn, Molly?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That ends my turn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty, that brings us to Jester.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I can't see anything on the other side.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, you can just see darkness.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: But we can boat in there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, I mean I will move the boat closer up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a strength check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that was terrible, six.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Six, okay. You struggle, it doesn't seem to get purchase. You're confused by this.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I can't move the boat, y'all.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, it's a lot going on in the moment and you're trying to figure out what to do. You don't quite have the gumption to get it catching up relatively fast. So it goes just five feet.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. Does that count as an action or a movement?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That would be your action on that one.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Cool.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Welcome back, Laura.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thanks. This is fun, guys. All right, then I'm going to save--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Mistress of the Hunt.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sweet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That ends Jester's turn. Yasha, you're up.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: His went into the water?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well no, you have no idea.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you hear a splash?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You watched as it slip around Nott and darkness envelop it, and that's all you know.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You heard a (yelp) (impact).

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You know the general direction of where it is.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Because I'm a Light Bearer.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are. You spend your action to create the Light cantrip. You watch as it flickers for a second and the darkness consumes the light. The spell has no effect.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay, I don't know if I can still do this as a bonus action. Can I try to slowly move us a little forward?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, if you want to. Well, that's an action to do that, technically, so you couldn't. You used your action to do the Light cantrip, unfortunately.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay. Yeah, okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So that's your turn?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah that's my turn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, Caleb you're up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I went from being able to see almost nothing to seeing nothing. I heard Nott get scholpped in and then I heard some cry. So I raise up the glove of blasting and I'm going to fire at where I think this thing is.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm dead.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's Scorching Ray for that?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Three attacks.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Three strikes at disadvantage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All at disadvantage because you're blind.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's correct. Okay, good. For the first is 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16 hits.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, let me do them all. 11.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 11 just hits.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Und

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All three hit, actually, even blinded.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (frantic noises) Plus that is ten. The total is 13.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But is still standing. You watch as the darkness flickers out of the way. There's flames burning around the outside and three giant singe marks on the outside of its rubbery skin. It's floating in the air there for a second before it's going back in for a swoop against the one who recently singed it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, before it hits me, I'll say I sit down on the bench and just go (whimper).

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, that ends your turn, top of the round. The boats continue further downstream.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What are those things on the side?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Those are just rocks.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's not a rock.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's fine. It's rocks.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Top of the round, Fjord, it's you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm going to cast Armor of Agathys on myself.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You watch as the moisture from the air and some of the water droplets from the river, from the splashing of the boat suddenly stick up and congeal in ice form around the outside of Fjord's body.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hex is still maintained on that bastard, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So I can roll 1d6. Or do I, for the-- I cast Hex on the one that was on Nott.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It only takes the 1d6 damage when you damage it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh shit, right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That ends Fjord's turn. Another one swoops down and is going to attempt to envelope the one that scorched its ally.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I am a monk, it's fine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's going to be a 14 to hit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, of course it hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You take nine points of bludgeoning damage and it is attached to you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah that's

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The one that is still existing is going to attempt to attach to you once again, Nott.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's going to be a 12 to hit.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Does not.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is a miss.

lines.name: LAURA, SAM
lines.text: Yay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Things are looking up, you guys.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That ends their go. Nott, you're up.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will, seeing the one on Caleb, spin around and fire my hand crossbow at that one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, go ahead and make an attack with disadvantage, because you are in melee with another creature. The other creature that tried to grapple you is right up against you. So it is still harrying you when you're trying to fire.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Disadvantage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Does she get sneak attack since I'm adjacent to that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, if she hits.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It was going to be good, ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ten does not hit, unfortunately. You attempt to fire and at the last minute it shifts out of the way. You can see Caleb's chest exposed to where you were aiming, and you pull back and fire wide off into the darkness.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Disadvantage, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So 20 to hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 20 does hit. You don't get sneak attack, however, because this guy is not engaged with anyone else. Go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will still say: Get off of my boat. I cause two points of damage. Oh wait, no! Six points of damage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: One question, is Frumpkin by the thing? Because Frumpkin is an ally.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I don't know if Frumpkin--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I know that I have read that Frumpkin can help me give me advantage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But he is not engaged, is he?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Whatever you want.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'd say for now, given the fact that Frumpkin is in a small boat and the creature is flying up, I would not consider it harrying the entity enough to grant sneak attack. But it doesn't matter. Because that was enough to finish it off. It had already been damaged quite a bit in the previous round. So as you fire your final crossbolt into that one it (impact) (splash) into the river below. You watch as it sink below the water as your boat begins to scoot by (scraping noise) and begins grinding against this center stone here in the middle of the river. It's just barely making its way around. Finishing that, that's the end of Nott's turn, Beau you're up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, is the one still next to me? That was attacking Fjord.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, that one has been slaughtered. There is one on Caleb over there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, there's one on Caleb. He's still on top of him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is currently attached to him around his head, yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm probably not within five feet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nope. There's probably about a ten foot distance between you and the other boat.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Leap for it!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, that's what I'm saying. I'm going to do some cool monk shit! I'm going to--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why do I get disadvantage?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Because it's a ranged attack.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, but I ignore all disadvantage with my Crossbow Expert feat.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh that's right, because you got a feat for it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you would not have disadvantage on that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, next time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, we'll let you roll damage for Caleb's because it did work.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's going to be a lot of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I forgot that you had gotten that feat. Go for it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, I don't even remember what I rolled.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The first one was high the second one was low.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. That's a lot. It's 20 points of damage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I would say leave me in that motherfucker.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That was an intense roll right now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's okay, I don't need it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So with that one moment as Beau's preparing, you manage one blast of the crossbow that strikes square into one of the eyes of the creature. You hear this this strange guttural pain sound as it's still holding onto Caleb, but seems to have taken a big hit. On your turn, Beau?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (confused battle cry) Continuing on, I'm going to leap across and see if I can do a jump and a slap with the staff on top.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For the purposes of this, roll an acrobatics check. This is a more parkour off of the boat using the weight.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is your jam.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Parkour.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The boat goes (bobbing in water).

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Get it, Altaïr.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sail!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you jump, skip off the ground and--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Skip off the ground?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: On the small stone in the center there and use the momentum from that with the staff swinging, go ahead make your strike against the--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to swing upwards. Yep, that's a natural 16, so 21. I don't know why I rolled that die, that's not necessary. Nine damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nine damage. With that, you manage to slap that one into two separate pieces that go slapping and sliding against the wall and splatter and begin to slick down the side of the cavern exterior.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I take my staff and I wipe it on Caleb.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your hair's slick back from the blood from the impact and the wound that gets taken.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: In a split second before when I heard a blunt (impact): Oh, that was Beau.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry, are you all right? Your head's okay?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm feeling pretty good. I feel streamlined.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, the oil's working for you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, I clean up well.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, very dapper.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ending Beau's turn, Beau, Caleb, Molly, and Jester you hear this mild rumble, and you watch as from the somewhat rocky outside of the two sides of the wall these large figures begin to burst from the exterior and begin to slowly make their way towards the edge. So their action and movement puts them right up to there, and this one moves up to there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Earth elementals?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see them covered in greenish algae and vines. They look like they're made of earth and stone. You're not certain what the nature of what they are. They're bottom heavy and crawling across the ground and pulling their body forward. You're not even sure if they have feet.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (screaming)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Good gravy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's going to end Beau's turn. Molly, you're up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my god.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You did a--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Sure, I know. Are they within striking distance?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're not yet, no.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to hold my action until something's within striking distance.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I will also say I'm at least going to back up to the side of the boat where I'm far enough away from that thing as humanly possible.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Well, that's where Jester is.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, well fine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you're like, "Oh!" Jester still has the oars in place. Does that finish your turn?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty, Jester your turn.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh gosh. Well, I hate to use my action to do anything else, but I should probably try to get away from the thing that's on the shore, huh?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're going to action row?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to action row!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, make a strength check please.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Strength check!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oar Master.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's a good one. That's just Jester's strength. That's a 22.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh shit! Jester is power rowing as it begins to (motor whir) down the river to about there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Half of the skiff.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Got to go!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You scoot by. The entity gets to the edge of the water and then watches it pass, its body shifting. It looks powerful, but it looks slow-moving.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to use my bonus action to turn around and go: Eat shit, rock face!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Perfect. That ends Jester's turn. Yasha, you're up.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: All right. Yeah, I'm going to try to--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Maneuver around?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Maneuver around.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Smash into their boat?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make a strength check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Still the only light in here are my four globules, correct?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct, which actually you had to roll a concentration check for.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh god.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Not so good.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so it is dark in here. Remember the Dancing Lights is concentration.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can we see anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, it is now absolutely pitch dark.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's pitch dark?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's pitch dark, yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Didn't you cast a Light spell?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I did.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It got eaten by the darkness.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What'd you roll?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19? Oh yeah. Without issue, you can row past and just begin to get beyond your friends there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We crash into each other and get stuck. Ah, let me go!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's going to end Yasha's go. Caleb, you're up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (foomphs)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, a couple lights go up again. You guys go from darkness to immediate light again and behind you see the two creatures dragging themselves forward by their upper body.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I scrabble back and squish in with Nott at the front of the boat.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Top of the round now. The water carries the boats further down--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We might be okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: To about there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think those things are going to get us.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Eventually.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll say here, with the movement of the creatures, actually, they can't catch up, because you guys managed to push ahead.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Action row!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Full Winklevoss twins!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For the purposes of cinematic movement on this, you guys continue to row as hard as you can, looking back with the light pushed towards the back to give a view. They are failing to keep up with both Yasha and Jester keeping the ships going at full speed. Eventually, they both stop and begin to back up, heading back towards the vicinity where they had originally emerged, disappearing into the shadows and darkness behind you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We'll never know what they were, what they could have done!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know. Actually, I'm feeling a little guilty for calling him-- What if he just wanted to be friends?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's true. Maybe they had information for us.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You're feeling guilty for calling him rock-face, but not for telling him to eat shit? I like that. That's great.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Bye!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As the sounds of the underground river begin to fill your senses once more, you settle and listen, and the quiet, aside from the slow rushing of the river, is all you hear. Who's at the front of each boat keeping an eye out?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm at the front of ours.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Fjord moves to the front of that boat. Who's at the front of the other?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I guess I am.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I would like you both to make a perception check, please.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Crazy roll there, Travis.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 12. Okay. As you guys are moving along, Fjord, mildly distracted, partially from the mist that is rising up from the ice and armor--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Drinking a drink with cold ice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Caleb, you focus off to the side, and to the north side of the riverbank you see a shift in texture and a mild rock slide. Part of the wall has caved in a bit and is now pushing into part of the river.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Halt. Wait. Stop.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He says to stop!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm trying!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Action brakes!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (squeals)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can you fight against the current for a moment?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, we're rowing backwards.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, it's going to get dark in here for a second, all right? But don't worry. I drop the globules and I cast Detect Magic.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So as you focus on-- What's the range on that one?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It is only 30 feet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 30 feet, okay. As you guys drift lazily down the course of the river--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Slowly.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm focusing, obviously, on the rock slide that you just described.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you move in that direction past the rock slide, you get a faint source of magic further beyond that rock slide.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Beyond the rock slide?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get a better look at it. Actually, you don't get a better look because you don't have light.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's on one side of the passage that we are in?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's on the north side of it, yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If I crane my neck in the other direction, is there anything on that side?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nope. Nothing of magical essence on that side of the chamber.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right, well, in the darkness, you hear: There is something of an arcane nature in the middle of those rocks that were ahead of us. What do you want to do? Do you want to go scrabbling in the dirt or do you want to keep going forward? It could be something beneficial or it could be terrible.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are there sides of the river?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Nobody can see anything right now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Those with darkvision get a better view as they get closer. At this point, you've gotten close enough for your magical essence so you get a view of this, Nott. You can see on the northern side of it, the cavern wall that has been slowly shifting through millennia of mineral buildup changes into bits of solid, smooth stone and a portion of it collapsed into what this rock slide is.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We were looking for a collapse. A change in texture.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We should go investigate.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This is it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we park the boats?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's park the boats.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we have some light?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Does anyone have a torch? I would prefer to keep this up for the time being.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I pull out a torch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yasha ignites a torch. The fire burns brightly and the interior of this chamber now is very easy to see the details around you. The water is still cruising by as you guys begin to make your way up along the shore a bit, stepping off to the side of the river and pulling the boats up on the rocks. They're not going to continue to be carried down by the stream.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to take my old little dry flowers and just stick them in his gross, ichor-y hair.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do I look like The Gentleman right now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The Gentleman on hard times, maybe.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A little less blue.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's not that weird.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's loose rock and pieces of well-carved stone and masonry that have been destroyed, apparently upon exiting whatever was beyond this wall.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can I see what was giving me the arcane signature?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You feel it on the opposite, the other side of this rock slide.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we clear out these rocks?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think we just need to get closer.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But we're right here.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. What about you two beefcakes? Can you move these stones out of the way?

lines.name: ASHLEY, LAURA
lines.text: (grunting)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Both of you make athletics checks to get through the endurance of pulling these stones out of the way.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, that's totally cocked, that was terrible. Athletics?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Between the two of you, about ten minutes pass as you watch your two beefy companions, one after another, moving large stones and rocks, scooping them out of the way, some spilling and rolling into the water, other ones being pushed off to the side.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Question, because the spell that I cast only lasts ten minutes, somewhere around the eight or nine minute mark, do I see-- You said it was on the other side of the rock slide, so are they uncovering anything before the spell is gone?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'd say about the time it begins to fade, you guys begin to see a faint purple glow through a breach of this slide leading into the next chamber. It's a very faint pinkish purple light source.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Like coming from another room?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Coming from that room. It looks like there's a room or a chamber beyond.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So not a door, but just a passageway?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're just starting to expose it a bit. All you're seeing is the light and stone on the opposite end. But there is a gap. There's about a ten-foot space between where you're starting to see this and where you see the light reflecting on whatever this other surface is within. About then, your spell fades.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The torch is still up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The torch is still up, yeah. You guys manage to pull the stones from it, the final bits leaving just enough of a space where you can crawl through independently. You are now looking into the center of a spiral staircase.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I remember they said they threw an explosive behind them and dropped even more, so this won't be the first rock slide.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They said that the glowing orbs that made the men collapse were purple.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This all checks out. We are in the right place.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Does that sound like a will-o'-wisp?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Will-o'-wisps generally fade like a dull yellow-green color.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Does this ring any bells, then?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not particularly. As you begin to move beyond, you can look up inside this spiral staircase. Above you and about two feet up the corner, there is a wrought iron cage that is built into the wall, containing a small crystal-like stone that is purple in color that is giving off this light source.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ooh. Hey, Caleb, look! Don't you want to steal that? It's probably magic.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's possible that I will want to steal it, but can I make anything out? Does it look like anything that I have read about or encountered before?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There have been different artifacts that have been enchanted with equivalents of either Continuous Flame or a magic that themselves can emanate light. The way it's affixed to here, it looks like it's designed to be a general light source.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So it's a glow stick.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Essentially, yeah. It's a purple glow stick.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, let's get in there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But it's in an iron cage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Like a small iron cage that is bolted into the stone.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's a nice sconce.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let's continue on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, you have two directions. Up or down?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Would you want to go up?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wait, we're in the spiral staircase and it goes--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're entering partway through the staircase.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We can't see around the bend to how far down it goes, right? Is it an open spiral staircase or just a wall?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, no. It's closed. There's an actual column in the center of it so you have to traverse up or down to get more of a view of where it leads.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Before we leave this little cage, does it look bolted into place?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's a couple flights up, though, you said?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, no. It's just right around the corner on the edge, locked into the central pillar.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We can only see as far up as the curves go in either direction.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. It looks like the edges of the cage where the metal has been bent--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's small?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's small. It's about that big and it's pressed into the stone, like the stone was probably ground into various holes and then the iron was put in there and then sealed in. You don't know how easy or hard it would be to remove.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Unless it lets people know when something crosses in front of it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Maybe later. Let's continue on. Which way do we want to go?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's go down. Usually scarier things are down.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm always a fan of going down.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: More expensive things tend to be up, but I'm happy to start with down.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Gross. Just gross.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're super gross.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I didn't even catch that!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You have one setting. Naughty.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Offensive!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're going to head downwards.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. What is the marching order heading downward?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're going down? Do you need me to check for traps?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, please.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, so Nott in front.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nott in front. Who's after Nott?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'll go behind Nott.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll take a big swig of shitty alcohol.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Who's after Yasha?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I guess I can be after Yasha.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Jester after Yasha.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm right in the middle.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm after Jester or after Fjord.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Where do you want to be?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll take up the rears.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (deep voice) I always take up the rears.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm always a fan of the rears.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, I was going to say not the back, but I will let the bruiser walk behind me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys slowly step down the stone stairs, deeper and deeper still--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Check for traps!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make an investigation check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's cocked as hell.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is that cocked? As hell?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Is there a number up top?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There is, but now it just moved.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll it again.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's an embarrassing 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys continue down for about 40 feet or so, very slowly, very carefully, as Nott inspects each individual step, eyes lurking around looking for any signs of uneven stone, of gaps between the mason work. Nothing catches your attention. You hit the very base of the stairway before it evens out. There is a small intermediate chamber that's about 15 feet wide and only about five feet-- sorry. 15 feet long and about five feet wide, and then a thin hallway about four or five feet wide that goes on for about 25 feet. You don't see anything beyond that. There is no light other than the torch light that you have currently.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's 15 feet long?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So as you exit the stairs--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The shaft is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's essentially five feet to each way on the ends.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughing) No!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Why are you cupping the balls under your mouth?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Because this is where we are.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a rusty trombone, man. You never seen that?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is the shaft in front of me, and then there's another? A longer shaft? So we can go down that shaft if we wanted to?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. Yes, Nott. That is correct. It looks to be five feet to each side of you once you exit the stairs, like a resting space.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, these are the balls.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And then there is a four to five-foot wide shaft that continues forward.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I know. I'm proud of you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Has it been that long?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't think so.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I have no idea of the layout of this room. I was just going for a gag.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Congratulations! Nott's been drinking enough where she's not entirely certain where things are or where you are.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are we free of traps in this little--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There are no traps here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Should we continue on straight ahead?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we send Frumpkin down there and see if it's clear?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Or Schmidt.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, Schmidt can't see shit, but Frumpkin-- can my cat see in the dark? I would know that. I don't know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Cats, generally nocturnal? I would say it would have, unless it says in the actual-- I will look in the Monster Manual. I'm fairly certain, having grown up with cats, that being nocturnal creatures they'd have it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It makes sense for anyone who had gone into their basement and seen the cat go (humming).

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, yeah. Cats can see.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Cats can see your soul.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They do not have darkvision, according to the rules.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, well, let's go by the rules, then.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The rules need to be changed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But they do have perception on vision.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Why don't you send your little dancing lights down there with him?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, I have a range on that. I don't like that idea, actually.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What if I just send something that's on fire and I throw it down the tunnel?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How about I send Frumpkin with you and between Frumpkin and you, we'll be in good shape?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Me and Frumpkin?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Am I protecting--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're just peeking.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. All right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Who am I behind? Mollymauk. I place hands on his shoulders and send Frumpkin down ten feet ahead of Nott and I'm seeing--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ten feet ahead of Nott?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, or listening, and trying to listen and see through Frumpkin.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Frumpkin darts ahead down that long, 25-foot, very thin hallway to the opposite side and in the next chamber, what little bit of light's making it in there-- because it's pretty low light, based on what little bit of torch is coming through, and it's like a lantern light at this point, because only what's coming through that hallway is then spreading out before you. You see a raised platform, about a foot high. It looks triangular in shape in the center of this room, and that's all you can make out with the little bit of light that's there, but the room continues on about another 20 or so feet beyond that entrance before it goes to darkness.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So it gets too dark and hazy past that altar.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yasha, can you hand the torch down and get it to Nott so that she can go a little bit further?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nott, are you traveling down the hallway as well?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm ten feet behind the cat.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. As you approach the first bit of that hallway that continues downward, you step in, and at that moment, you hear this (click) and glance over to the right of you, as you checked for traps in the stairs, but not the hallway. You glance off to the side and can see a scattering of holes on each side of the wall, about nine or ten of them at different angles, and one of them goes (click). You glance over before something comes firing out at extremely fast, lightning speed towards you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Rogue shit!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's going to be a 26 to hit.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You take five points of piercing damage as a long, metal bolt fires out of the hole and sticks you right in the front of the thigh.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I found a trap!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Really?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is it spent now?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let me check. I'll see if there's any other triggers for this trap.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: On this trap, at this floor point? You jump up and down. Make an investigation check if you want to, in the area.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It looks like, whatever this trap is, the actual entire stone floor around you is a pressure plate that Frumpkin did not set off. It has not gone off since you've stepped on it, but as you're investigating and listening closely to the stone, you hear a very slow (clicking).

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, it's resetting.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to go forward a bit, onto the next pressure plate.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, that is 14 to hit?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Does not hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Does not hit? This time, hearing the (arrow firing) out of the side, and being ready for it, you duck out of the way and it splinters off and sparks against the stone.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh god. There's many of them.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are you going to tell everybody about the pressure plates?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh god, there's lots of traps! I'm dying out here! (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're just seeing you. You're really close to us, aren't you?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Boy, oh boy, rogues suck. How much further until the end of this hall?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: About ten feet from where you are.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can you disarm the traps so you don't keep just setting them off?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do we have anything heavy to put on them to hold them down?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They reset, though, right? I don't know!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We don't know.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm on this one, and I'm going to listen to see if this one's resetting also.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (ticking sound)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, I'll see if there's a way to disarm it, or plug the hole, or something.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, go ahead and make a thieves' tools check, which is your proficiency bonus plus dexterity modifier. Should be plus six, I think?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 18, okay. Looking at this central platform here, as you inspect it, listening to where it's clicking, you listen for the holes that are clicking. Most of these holes are not actually functional, they're just there to confuse whoever might notice that there's an issue. Only one of them is active, and you listen very closely and listen for the one that's making the clicking noise, and you quickly take one of your thieves' tools-- or, not your thieves' tools, something on you that can plug that hole. A piece of stone, something that you might have in your vicinity that might function to that degree.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A button!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ball bearings you stole from me.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I do have ball bearings. Hold on, I have so many things.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (ticking sound)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh god. I don't want to get rid of that, that's cute. A vase!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The holes are about that big.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ah, shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (ticking sound)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I take my brass doorknob and shove it in there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, there is a section of the doorknob that will fit within that hole. You jam it in there, and you push and grind it in there until it feels wedged in the stone, and eventually you hear (ticking) (swoosh) and the door knob cracks for a second, and there's no more clicking. Apparently you have managed to break that device.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I am going to take the doorknob back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you pull the doorknob out--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With disadvantage-- Oh, no that's a 12 to hit.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It shoots out anyway?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It shoots out anyway, but haphazardly, and then it breaks.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Great.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You hear a (clanking) on the inside of the wall there, and that trap is busted.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are there any more?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know! I check for more traps. Two for investigation.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Two for investigation?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Has the party held up at this point?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys are all just in the back watching this happen.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know how to be a rogue!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is there anything dangerous or hinky?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, thank you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I rolled a seven. That was not a two, it was a seven.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, hard to tell at this point.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Great. We're all clear!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The chamber you're in right now? Looking around, you can see a heavy layer of dust across the floor and the edges of the wall.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is where Frumpkin is, correct?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh! Sorry, I thought you were checking for yourself.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Through Frumpkin's eyes. The half of the room, or the portion of the room that Frumpkin can see.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The portion that Frumpkin can see is just the center platform. The center platform, looking on top, has a series of symbols on it. Looking close, Frumpkin can see they aren't symbols that are drawn on it, they are carved in. Actually, the triangular shape resembles that. The center hole is the deepest. It goes out of sight. The other ones are just mild carvings in the stone.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no, is this going to be a puzzle?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I hope so.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, fuck me.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Definitely a puzzle.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: So that's what's up ahead?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you guys are still back waiting for Nott to finish walking through.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm just going to run across.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're just going to run across?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm just going to run across and pick up Nott on the way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you're like, "Coast is clear!" Yasha comes rushing past. In the time that it's taken, the first trap has reset. That is going to be an 18 to hit?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Uh-huh.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ooh, that is 11 points of piercing damage, as it strikes you in the back of the calf, actually piercing through the muscle, and you stumble for a second. You rush past the floor where Nott is. No effect. The third one: it goes off. Another trap. That is going to be a 14 to hit.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, that just hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's going to be seven piercing damage to that one. This one catches you in the back, in the side of your rib cage, under your shoulder blade, and you manage to emerge into the next chamber with the torch now. Wounded--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Fuck!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But you made it through. They're both sticking out of you as you turn around and look in the chamber.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Maybe nobody else do that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, I'm going to run.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I feel like this is going well.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm running.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. As you guys run through, it's still resetting. Who's going through?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going for it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are we all going?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ah! I'm running!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm holding onto Mollymauk and just following.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Who's holding up the back?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll hold up the back. I want to look around and see if I see anything that looks of value.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check with disadvantage, because you're now outside of the main light. The rest of you rush through, making it through, the traps have reset.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll take that natural one and give another $100 to 826LA.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Beau takes a moment there. Looking around the corners, it looks like this portion of the chamber is more of an antechamber or something that leads into the next bit. There's nothing of worth or interest.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, just things to shoot you in the fucking legs.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait up for me!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You run to the first chamber. It shoots out towards you. That's cocked. That's going to be a 16 to hit?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Miss.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Misses. Just past you. The second platform, Nott's already disarmed. No effect. Third platform. Does come shooting out at you. That is going to be a natural 20.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Ooh!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I want to catch it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay! Let's see if it works.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Knowing it's coming.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's down low, though.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 13 points of piercing damage for that one.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 1d10 plus eight.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You can do it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Get it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (groan) Wait, how many?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 11. You catch it and it embeds itself about an inch into your chest before you pull it out.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I caught it! Argh!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You throw the bolt to the ground and continue on to the chamber. You only suffer two points of damage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Those are from earlier.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I am so sorry. I did not handle that very well. I was told to check for traps and I missed many of them and I will strive to do better in the future and I'm sorry and this one, this one's on me.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's okay, Nott.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm sorry.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I pat your head. You know, it's a lot of stress. You're learning still.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It is! All these traps are different. I wish they would just stick with the rope across the hallway trap.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Then the log coming down!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah. That's the one I know. It's a tried and true classic.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's classic, really.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys now have a moment here to take in the chamber around you, Yasha holding the torch aloft, lighting up the vicinity. You're now standing inside a tall, octagonal chamber that rises up about 25, 30 feet above you. A domed ceiling with abstract designs and symbols written in each pie-slots of this octagon around.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're at Burning Man, aren't we? We're at Burning Man.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is a great installation.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see in the center where all of these triangular pieces of the dome meet in the center, there is a blue, thick ten foot wide pillar that descends about ten feet from the ceiling, about 15 feet above you. It's square and ominously held aloft.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That thing's going to try to kill us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Below that, you see there is that triangular piece of stone and there is no visible exit to the chamber.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is that triangular piece of stone raised off the floor?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's raised off the floor about a foot or so.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How big is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For each side, it's about two and a half feet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's this thing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's that thing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How wide is the whole chamber again?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The whole chamber would probably be about 50 to 60 feet wide.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh wow. It's big.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If we're just coming into the area, which edge is pointing towards us? The flat or the point?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From your perspective entering, this would be the front end and there's these two sides there. You have the dome with all these symbols and strange designs upon each of these eight pieces of the octagon dome.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do I recognize any of these symbols? Does anything look familiar?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: From your brief life.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What skills are you trained in?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Skills?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What skills you got?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I got acrobatics, insight, deception, sleight of hand.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. What do you have? Proficient in?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (whistling) Going to have to get back to you. Perception, intimidation, investigation.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, there's a little dot next to it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Investigation and survival also.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Arcana, insight, investigation.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, as you look up. First off, as Yasha holds the torch up so you can see the symbols.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh shit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What?! This is intricate.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Look how cool!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What are they? They're all over the ceiling?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I have that kids' toy that makes these. You spin it and the little pen goes around and around.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are all those facing towards Fjord?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All of these are from Fjord's perspective.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Those are on the ceiling?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Those are on the ceiling, yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to walk around the immediate area checking for traps. 22.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 22. As you slowly crawl your way around the exterior, checking the stone, checking the placement. You do see that each of these symbols are about maybe half an inch thick into there except for the centerpiece, which you cannot tell how deep it is. The hole in the center goes down for a while, from what you can tell.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You said this was pretty big.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's about two to two and a half feet to each side.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: On the ground? Just on the ground?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, flat on the ground.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No traps?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do not see any traps around the interior of the chamber.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Something was giving off an arcane aura before we came in here, but I cannot see it now, so if you indulge me and give me ten minutes, I will--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ten minutes?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, take your time.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I do a check to see if I recognize any of these things?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Are you trained in arcana?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can use my mystical erudition to spend a ki point.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I will say because of your monk background, I will allow you to go ahead and attempt it as well. If the two guys trained in arcana as well are looking up at the symbols and studying them, you are welcome to do so.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I get advantage on this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you spend a ki point, yes you do.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are the symbols just painted on the ground, or are they carved into the ground?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Those symbols on the ceiling of each space--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They're on the ceiling?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're on the ceiling in each octagonal piece of the dome; they're painted above in a circle around.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. In the focus of intending to cast the Detect Magic spell, you're not as focused on the symbols. However, the two of you, keenly, together, staring up at the ceiling, begin to make out something similar in these patterns. You don't fully understand it, as it comes from whatever knowledge was imparted upon you from this entity you've made a pact with. You, however, in studying various forms of the arcane and coming into knowledge that isn't your specialty, but knowing it is definitely a specialty, you look at each of these symbols, and these are not classically used, they're improvised interpretations, or specific re-toolings of the symbols that mean each of the eight schools of magic. Between Fjord and Beau, you guys get to make out what each of these symbols means.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, shit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Cool.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So I don't know why I know this.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, it's like magic people code.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The people I learned from were super into this shit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does that mean we have to cast some spells or something?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think it's a puzzle. I feel like this thing rotates and we have to match the symbols on the bottom to the symbols that match the school of magic. It feels like the divination is a full symbol of the star.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It feels like the triangle is down here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Evocation, right? Then the diamond--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You can tell if you were to rotate it, it would line up. Triangle to triangle, that would bring the star to that one there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What would the diamond be?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's a diamond right there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Does it look like it goes inside?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can give it a shot if you want to.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll go gingerly touch the base and see if it moves a little bit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It does not shift at all.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is anyone on the platform?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Currently, no.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I wonder if you have to stick something in the hole and twist it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I bet there's a key.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Caleb is still going through the ritual.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fuck it, I'll stand up on the platform.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, you step onto the platform. A moment passes. Two. No effect.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I look down into that black hole in the center of it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can, although in the light source Yasha's currently holding, it just looks like shadow.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Do you want it?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I have darkvision. Oh, yeah, I'll take the torch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, you take the torch and hold it over to give you a better glance over it. The hole descends about a foot and a half and stops.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Stick your wang in it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I will put my finger in the hole, actually. I don't know how big the hole is, but I want to feel if there are any grooves on the inside or any sort of indentations.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right. It's roughly a half inch wide, so about that wide.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I put my little pinkie in it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Fits inside.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Solid walls?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Solid walls on the inside.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, it's short. There anything around here that looks like a staff or a pole or rod?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to start looking around, digging, seeing if I see anything that looks like it would fit the shape. I'm also going to shout out: Be careful, the shifty three were talking about an octagonal room where they got attacked.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The floor around this triangle shape, it's flush in the ground, right? There's no circle around the triangle platform?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct. It is just flush and set in the ground.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So the ground's not going to move. Maybe the ceiling has to move.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, because of the thing in the middle.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right. We're not going to be able to turn the floor.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How do we turn a ceiling?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe we've got to go all the way back up to the top.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's my thought.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The top of what?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The spiral staircase.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: To see from the top?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We need a down here team and an up here team and maybe a Frumpkin to communicate through.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, I will remember this. I have a perfect memory, I will remember this exactly.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does the pillar coming out of the ceiling have a hole in it as well?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She's good at finding holes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I am really good at finding holes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She talks about them a lot.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Glancing up at it, the pillar itself comes down in a square-shape, and the very base of it has a slight curvature or dome to it, but it is solid. You don't see any seams in it, you don't see any marking. It is just a solid pillar. It's about ten feet wide or so.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Has ten minutes gone by yet?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point, yeah, as they began to look around. You said you're searching for anything else in the chamber.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That looks like it would fit in the rod.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you begin to slowly make your way around the room, looking for any markings.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I feel like that goes in the hole.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But the hole is--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This wide.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, the hole is--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The hole is like a half-inch wide.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You spend a little while looking for any signs of grooves or where anything's hidden. The chamber is solid, and there is nothing in the room that looks like it would-- there's nothing to grab on to. There are no other objects in here. It's fairly empty, aside from this dome, that octagonal shape, and this small engraving on the ground, and that pillar at the top.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Caleb, do you have anything to draw these symbols?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, Jester draws great. Jester can draw.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, yeah! Jester, please, both of you, yeah. Just to get a rendition of the ceiling in relation to the ground.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I open up my sketchbook and I start drawing the symbols. Here, look, I made this beautiful picture.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You work so fast.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, I'm really talented.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You don't have a heal cantrip, do you?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Cantrip? No.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I have some potions.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Did Detect Magic reveal what was glowing in here before?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, this chamber is far further below. It's 40 feet below where you guys initially came through, so whatever you sensed earlier would have been near where you entered.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, it was just the glow stick.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It was probably the glow stick, yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think maybe we need to see where those stairs go up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The stairs are back through the hall and up, right? They're not in these chambers? It's one big chamber?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nope. One big chamber with no other exit beyond the hallway you entered from.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right, I'll jog up the stairs.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wait. You're going to wait until she disarms the--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is my chance for redemption.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, sorry.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let me break the traps first.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Get it, girl.

lines.name: TRAVIS, MARISHA, ASHLEY
lines.text: (singing) Get it girl, get it, get it girl.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (singing) To the front, to the side, to the back. Disarm that trap.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I have a handful of ball bearings?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I hand Nott a handful of ball bearings.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thank you. I'll start working on it. I'm going to disarm trap three.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 19, plus stuff.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, yeah. The next trap you come up to, you leap up onto the side, using your fingers to dig into some of the holes there, and jam about three ball bearings into the one hole that you see is the one where the bolt is actually embedded within, and as soon as you step back down, you hear this grinding noise, and the trap is pretty shattered from the inside.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, I'm going to go to trap one. Ooh, not as good. Six plus six, right? 12?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 12. The middle one is still broken. There's only three platforms you've seen that actually lead to this trap. You've broken two of them. The third and final one, you go to attempt to put the ball bearing in there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh boy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: However, it does shoot forth, through your thumb. That's going to be a 21 to hit.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, yeah, that hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You take eight points of piercing damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Redemption is fucking painful.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Actually, it goes through your thumb and into your hand and into your wrist, and so you're bolted through there and it's sticking out right there, and you're like (shocked sounds). The shock hits you-- you don't feel the pain yet, you're looking at it jutting through your hand.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (heavy breathing)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We can fix that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: While it's reloading, I'm going to jam some ball bearings in with my other hand and try to break it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, go for it. Roll one more time.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nine.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is that including the bonus?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have too much pain from your hand.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She's too drunk.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What else I got?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's going to be a 13 to hit.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Misses.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you duck out of the way. You attempt to jam it back in.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (frustrated growl) I'm going to try one more time. Natural 20! (cheering)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Angrily, with your one good hand, you take a handful of bearings and jam them inside, holding your wrist there as you can feel the (impact) inside, and then a spring breaks somewhere beneath the stone. All three traps have been disabled.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sorry, 826.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (relieved panting) All clear!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, well done with-- oh my god, your hand!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's fine, it's nothing. It's fine, it's just a little blood.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's-- ugh.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You want to deal with that right away.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (pained groaning)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey, can I keep that? I think I can throw it later.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, here you go.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thank you. Thanks, Nott.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Did you just pocket a thumb?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, that's the bolt.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, sorry, here's your thumb back. I just want the bolt.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Big Lebowski.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You want a toe? I can get you a toe.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you're bleeding profusely from your wounded hand, you guys head up the stairway?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, who's going up?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, here's what I think: I can send these little globules of light quite a ways, and I can also send Frumpkin quite a ways, so why don't we let Frumpkin have a look and we just hang back?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think let's all head up in that direction, but put Frumpkin first. I think Frumpkin ahead, but let's--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ten feet ahead is fine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I have a feeling there's going to be a lever-y or a move-y situation.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're also going to have to keep checking for traps and then we'll send people down when we need it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, you might need opposable thumbs.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hey! It's too soon!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, we start heading up with Frumpkin ten feet in front.

lines.name: LIAM
